member.name: M:System.Design.NativeMethods.HandleCollector.Add(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds the given handle to the handle collector. This keeps the handle on a "hot list" of objects that may need to be garbage collected.
member.param: The handle to add.
The type of the handle. This must be a value returned from a prior call to HandleCollector.RegisterType().
member.returns: the handle passed In. This allows for syntatic convienence.

member.name: M:System.Design.NativeMethods.HandleCollector.RegisterType(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Registers a new type of handle with the handle collector.
member.param: The name of the handle type, such as "GDI", "Window", etc. The given type must have unique create and destroy functions, so that adds and removes can be balanced.

This is a percentage that guages how "expensive" the given handle type is to keep around. Handle types with a higher percentage will be collected more often than handle types with a lower expense. This number should be from 0-100
member.returns: an integer that identifies the new type. The value will always be greater than zero.

member.name: M:System.Design.NativeMethods.HandleCollector.Remove(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the given handle from the handle collector. Removing a handle removes it from our "hot list" of objects that should be frequently garbage collected.
member.param: The handle to remove.
The type of the handle. This must be a value returned from a prior call to HandleCollector.RegisterType().
